newsitem.title: GERMANY: German construction to fall two pct in 1997 - group.
newsitem.headline: German construction to fall two pct in 1997 - group.

text.p: The German construction was expected to see production fall a real two percent in 1997, less than previously expected and less than the 2.7 percent downturn of 1996, the Association of the German Construction Industry (HDB) said on Wednesday.

HDB said production in eastern Germany was seen falling 4.1 percent, largely due to the ending of special tax incentives for investments in the region, association chief Otmar Franz said at a news conference.
Production in western Germany, where the industry was closer to recovery, production would fall 1.4 percent, he said.
